analysis: The documents in this cluster primarily concern the use of economic sanctions and trade restrictions as tools of foreign policy and national security. They involve blocking assets, restricting trade, and imposing investment limitations on individuals and entities deemed to be threats or engaged in activities that undermine U.S. interests or international stability. The documents span multiple administrations and address various countries and situations, reflecting a consistent application of economic pressure in response to perceived threats.
title: Economic Leverage for National Security
